review_title: Great Place to Work But You Might Outgrow It If Your Ambitious"
pros: The hospital has very nice staff and they were a pleasant to work with.  The nurses were fantastic and the patients represented come from various social and economic backgrounds. However, I felt the doctors were a bit mediocre though the residents were quite good. If you a re a junior person, such as a nurse aide, lab tech, pharmacy tech, there is room for growth if you do an excellent job. I would highly recommend working at West Jeff while in nursing or allied health school. You will get excellent experience and encouragement from the staff.
cons: You will need to push yourself to succeed. Sometimes your co-workers will call in sick and if you're a hard worker, you'll find yourself constantly called in to work for them.

pros: a good majority of the nurses and some of the doctors are genuinely interested in seeing you grow and develop as a nurse.  Great place to make lifelong friends.
cons: It's a good thing most of the nurses and some of the doctors are really dedicated to their patients because all management is worriede about is $$$.

pros: WJMC brings a sense of family to the workplace. I work with a community that I feel connected to. This drives me to excel in my job role and continually seek ways to improve the organization.
cons: The management structure is antiquated. Leadership gives me no confidence that they are taking the business in a positive direction. Constant change to our environment is poorly thought out, if at all. Patient care suffers greatly from incompetence.

job_title: Air Care Flight Nurse in Marrero, LA
pros: I was a Flight Nurse at WJ and enjoyed a constantly challenging job. When not flying, I took trauma patients, another constant challenge which I welcomed. Love my staff and the doctors, and of course my pilots. I am still in touch with some of the people I worked with back then. Fond memories. Competitive salaries back then.
cons: Watch your paycheck. By not paying me 10 min here, 10 min there, they had to end paying me almost $1000 when the review I requested was over.

job_title: Production Planner / Business Unit Supervisor in New Orleans, LA
pros: Great staff of medical professional
cons: I loved West Jefferson Medical Center.I worked with that company since 1989 until the lab was leased out to Delta Pathology. That lease was a mistake and none of the employees in the lab are happy. I had never seen so many people quit or walk-out in all the years I had worked. I hope West Jefferson Medical Center will never have to lease out another department in the hospital ever again.

review_title: Nice but I'm relieved to be gone
pros: The atmosphere is always upbeat, coworkers are nice, and the food is really good in the cafeteria.
cons: Horrible pay.  Boss was only qualified on paper and her people skills and work ethic were terrible.  There was nobody I could go to about her actions because they all stick together.

review_title: Incompetent Upper Management, Out of Touch with the Rest of the Hospital
pros:
Great coworkers
Middle management is great, but upper management ties their hands
Not picky about personal emergencies, tardiness
Doctors, for the most part, are very nice
cons:
Upper management leaves much to be desired, and aren't as impressive as they would have you believe
Cafeteria is run by Sodexo and is the worst hospital food in the city
Staffing is according to a grid and not to patient acuity
Inappropriate patients assigned to inappropriate areas where the nurses have no idea how to take care of them
Set schedules with random employees being scheduled for 60 or more hours a week without their consent and told to "suck it up"
Orientation is a complete waste of time with 2 weeks classroom time for nursing which has nothing to do with anything you really need to know, and this is before you are placed with your preceptor.
Middle management expected to not only manage their unit but to serve as a floor nurse, also, on a regular basis. 
There is no respect for the individual having a life outside of their employment at WJMC
Even though WJMC is a Center of Excellence in Bariatric Surgery, the hospital's insurance (Gilsbar, which is determined by the hospital) refuses to pay for employees to have bariatric surgery regardless of medical exception. But if you work for EJGH and have Gilsbar, you can come to WJMC and have this surgery completely without out of pocket expenses.

review_title: It's been an okay experience. All I can say is I love what I do.
pros: My coworkers get me through the days at work. Team work.
cons: 1 percent raises for the whole year when upper management is sitting pretty with there bonuses.

pros: The staff and nurses truly care about about the patients they provide care for.
cons: There are no Cons involving West Jefferson Medical Center that I have encountered or been a a part of.

pros: The hours were good. Cafeteria food is good.
cons: Must be in the clique to progress. VP level is all politics and it funnels down the organization creating hostility and confusion.

review_title: The worst job I ever had
pros: Nice coworkers and direct managers.
cons: Set schedules; inappropriate staffing; inappropriate patients in certain patient areas (example--C-Diff patients on Mother Baby Unit who had no ob or gyn diagnosis--house supervisor told us to "just keep that door shut); horrible food (Sodexo); CEO is a piece of work--she is rude and condescending--overall, not a good place to work for anyone who wants a life.
